headline.print_headline: Joblessness Shortens Lifespan of Least Educated White Women, Research Says
headline.main: Joblessness Shortens Lifespan of Least Educated White Women, Research Says

docs.abstract: Study published in The Journal of Health and Social Behavior finds that main factors contributing to declining life expectancy among least educated white women are smoking and joblessness.
docs.lead_paragraph: The aim of the new study was to explain the growing gap in mortality between white women without a high school diploma and those with a high school diploma or more.
docs.snippet: The aim of the new study was to explain the growing gap in mortality between white women without a high school diploma and those with a high school diploma or more.

headline.seo: New Rules Give Employers Leeway on Use of Health Incentives
headline.print_headline: Employers Get Leeway On Health Incentives
headline.main: Employers Get Leeway on Health Incentives

docs.abstract: Obama administration issues final rule that gives employers greater leeway to use employee wellness programs; it allows employers to reward or penalize employees who meet specific standards related to their health.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration issued a rule that employers could reward or penalize employees who meet specific standards related to their health.
docs.snippet: The Obama administration issued a rule that employers could reward or penalize employees who meet specific standards related to their health.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

keywords.name: organizations

headline.main: Is It Better to Walk or Run?

docs.abstract: New studies that pit running against walking found that if your goal is to lose weight, running wins. But in other measures of health, walking can be at least as valuable as running — and in some instances more so.
docs.snippet: New studies that pit running against walking found that if your goal is to lose weight, running wins. But in other measures of health, walking can be at least as valuable as running — and in some instances more so.
